seo.title: Fundamental Analysis Quiz – Test Your Market Knowledge | Qption
seo.description: Challenge your understanding of macroeconomics, interest rates, inflation, and market behavior with Qption’s Fundamental Analysis Quiz. Learn and trade smarter.
seo.keywords: fundamental analysis quiz, macroeconomics, forex quiz, inflation, interest rates, central banks, GDP, CPI, carry trade, Qption
seo.ogTitle: Fundamental Analysis Quiz – Test Your Market Knowledge | Qption
seo.ogDesc: Interactive quiz to test your grasp of economic indicators, central banks, inflation, and global markets.

ui.intro: Challenge your macro mindset with our interactive Fundamental Analysis Quiz — test your grasp of growth and inflation data, central bank policy, interest-rate differentials, fiscal impacts, and cross-asset dynamics to become a more informed, conviction-driven trader.
ui.selectPrompt: Select an option and submit your answer.
ui.resultHigh: Excellent! Your macro radar is sharp.
ui.resultMid: Nice work! Keep practicing to level up.
ui.resultLow: Good start—review the lessons and try again.

pool.q: Which indicator is most directly used as the primary gauge of consumer inflation?
pool.explain: The Consumer Price Index tracks changes in prices for a basket of goods/services and is a primary inflation gauge.

pool.q: A rising GDP print, all else equal, most likely suggests:
pool.explain: GDP measures total output; a rise generally reflects growth momentum.

pool.q: Which release can spark large FX moves due to labor market implications?
pool.explain: Employment data influences rate expectations and growth outlooks, often moving currencies.

pool.q: When a central bank cuts its policy rate, it most commonly aims to:
pool.explain: Lower rates reduce financing costs, supporting demand and investment.

pool.q: Bond prices typically move _____ to interest rates.
pool.explain: As yields rise, existing fixed coupons are less attractive, pushing prices down (and vice versa).
Central banks shape expectations via guidance on likely policy paths.

pool.q: High inflation tends to _____ a currency unless offset by higher rates.
pool.explain: Inflation erodes purchasing power; rate hikes can counteract via higher yields.

pool.q: Some investors view Bitcoin as a potential inflation hedge because:
options: Its supply is capped by protocol
It is pegged to the USD
pool.explain: Perception of scarcity leads some to treat BTC as a hedge during high inflation regimes.

pool.q: A classic currency carry trade seeks to:
options: Borrow in high-rate currencies and lend in low-rate currencies
Borrow in low-rate currencies and invest in high-rate currencies
pool.explain: Positive interest differentials can accrue carry—until volatility/regime shifts hit.

pool.q: During geopolitical stress, investors often rotate toward:
options: Safe-haven assets (e.g., gold, CHF, JPY, Treasuries)
pool.explain: Uncertainty drives demand for perceived safety and liquidity.
Aim: boost aggregate demand, growth, and employment during slowdowns.

pool.q: A key risk of persistent fiscal deficits is:
options: Rising public debt and interest burdens
pool.explain: High debt reduces flexibility and can crowd out other priorities.

pool.q: A high debt-to-GDP ratio can signal:
pool.explain: Heavy debt loads may impair growth and currency confidence if not managed.

pool.q: Commodity prices are primarily driven by:
pool.explain: Supply disruptions or demand surges (e.g., growth, weather) move prices.

pool.q: Which of the following is commonly viewed as a safe-haven asset?
pool.explain: In turbulence, capital often rotates to gold, CHF, JPY, and high-quality sovereign bonds.

pool.q: Equities and FX/CFDs can move together because both are influenced by:
options: The same macro drivers (growth, inflation, rates, risk appetite)
pool.explain: Macro regimes (risk-on/off) often show cross-asset correlations.

options: Affect adoption, liquidity, and market structure
pool.explain: Rules shape on/off-ramps, institutions’ access, and behavior.

pool.q: At a high level, blockchains secure transaction history using:
pool.explain: Consensus (e.g., PoW/PoS) and cryptographic linking maintain integrity.
